title: flask 2.0 upgrade

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
### Flask has released 2.0
https://palletsprojects.com/blog/flask-2-0-released/
https://flask.palletsprojects.com/en/2.0.x/changes/

### Appears easy upgrade
For our usage it appears no or few changes would be required because:

The main thing was them dropping python `3.5` and older.

Given we target `runs-on: ubuntu-latest`
https://askubuntu.com/questions/1232812/whats-the-default-python-version-in-ubuntu-20-04 
and it appears that comes with python `3.8.2`. 

And here we target python `3.7`
https://github.com/diffgram/diffgram/blob/7ce652c187714f216d78bafbe6154d28e1945500/walrus/Dockerfile#L14

### Ecosystem
We would also want to upgrade

#### flask_limiter
https://flask-limiter.readthedocs.io/en/stable/changelog.html
seems like mostly additions, and our usage of it is pretty minimal. we don't have either deprecated flag `RATELIMIT_STORAGE_URL` or `RATELIMIT_GLOBAL`. and we moved away from `get_ipaddr` to the get_address thing a while ago I think

#### werkzeug
 https://werkzeug.palletsprojects.com/en/2.0.x/changes/
just skimmed but also appears ok
they also upgraded `ProxyFix` to cover ipv6

### Related
This also may fix https://github.com/diffgram/diffgram/issues/685
